intro: Galium kuetzingii, commonly known as silverweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white, five-petaled flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are covered in fine, silky hairs, giving the plant a silvery appearance. Galium kuetzingii thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas and along stream banks.
